website_summaries.verdict: From growing puppies to small, light chewers, this combo-pack is a versatile, affordable choice.
pros: A duo that is geared to puppies' unique chewing needs – a "starter" softer teething bone and a harder "graduate" ring bone
Also a good choice for small dogs or those that aren't prone to rough, prolonged chewing
cons: Not durable enough for dogs prone to excessive chewing
Won't stand up to use by most large breeds
Some reports of disinterest in the ring bone

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous
customer_reviews.text: I wish Amazon would not sell this product; my puppy woke up from a nap throwing up pieces of this bone. Fortunately he didn't chew on this long enough to get more than a few bits into his stomach. These bones are dangerous and should not be marketed as puppy teething products. I'd never buy Nylabone products ever again.
customer_reviews.author: d.wils 2017

customer_reviews.title: One bone can only be given to pre-teething puppies
customer_reviews.text: My puppy loves these toys. They don't smell like they're flavored, but judging by the way she gnaws away at them, they must be! My main complaint is that these are "teething" toys, but one is for puppies with NO adult teeth. Teething, by definition, means the puppy is currently growing in some adult teeth. This means that the soft toy is great for **pre-teething puppies only**. Please follow the package directions and don't give the softer bone to a puppy with any adult teeth. They will rip it to shreds, which is dangerous to them and a mess to clean up!
customer_reviews.author: Live.Laugh.Love.

customer_reviews.title: OK but the ring is hard for the puppy to bite
customer_reviews.text: The ring is really hard. But the other bone was great. Our pup enjoyed the soft one until I had to throw out the little nub that was left. The ring is in her toy box but it is just too hard.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Keep an eye on your dog...
customer_reviews.text: So my English Bulldog loves these chew bones. However, he is able to chew through them pretty quick. And considering they aren't natural, I have to really watch him, because he swallows all of the little crumbs/pieces. They will end up making him sick to his stomach and he throws up. I gave these chew bones 3 stars, because they aren't worth the money and they aren't edible. They should cost half the price. Its basically a hard piece of plastic. Now that my dog is bigger, I can't trust him with these bones and will no longer buy them. I recommend looking for something else thats more natural.
customer_reviews.author: tldward

customer_reviews.title: Puppy ate a quarter of the bone
customer_reviews.text: Owner of a three month old Ausiedor here. My puppy was able to chew off one end of the puppy bone in one day. It's astonishing how much of this plastic she was able to chew and eat Over the course of a few hours. None of the pieces were broken off or came off in large chunks but it was still a significant amount of plastic to disappear. I have yet to give her the ring bone because the packaging indicates it is for puppies with permanent teeth but I'm fairly confident she can take that down in no time.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia

customer_reviews.title: The BROWN One Is The GREAT One
customer_reviews.text: The reason for the 4 Star instead of 5 is only because of the yellow chew with the ring, and neither dog likes that one at all. The dogs have been having a championship game of Hide and Seek with the BROWN bone. It's a bit softer and chewer and maybe has a better flavor. They LOVE it. I must find where to order more of these alone. This little brown chew is the Top Pick from the 10 different chew toys I just ordered.... (Can you believe how much $$ do we spend on these creatures)? smh.......
customer_reviews.author: M Ricci

customer_reviews.title: Great for my labradoodle puppy
customer_reviews.text: These nylabones are perfect for my teething labradorite puppy. They are small enough that she can pick them up and carry then in her mouth, but big enough that she is not at risk for swallowing anything. Though she chews them frequently, I haven't seen any damage or pieces coming off the bones.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: MMy adult dog keeps trying to steal it from the puppy
customer_reviews.text: My adult dog isn't a big chewer, but he loves the bone meant for small puppies. I always take it away from him, since it's too soft for his teeth, and can cause an upset stomach if he breaks off chunks and eats them. My puppy likes it as well, though she likes anything. She doesn't particularly prefer these toys over wires or shoes though. After spending a bunch of money on various chew toys, we found out her favorite things to chew are sticks from outside. After allowing her to bring some sticks indoors, she's pretty much lost all interest in chewing wires.
customer_reviews.author: Nox

customer_reviews.title: Flavorless ring, and too-soft bone
customer_reviews.text: My puppy destroyed the bone toy within a matter of hours. It does not have the durability of many other Nylabone puppy chews. The petite ring doesn't seem to be flavored, and my puppy ignored it completely. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Teacup Squid

customer_reviews.title: Puppy loves these!!
customer_reviews.text: Great deal! We love Nylabone for our puppy. Our bigger dog destroys even the hardest plastic toys, so we don’t let her chew on any synthetic bones for very long. But our puppy loves Nylabone! She’s 11 weeks old and loves the “starter” bone (on the right). We’ll graduate to the harder bone in a few weeks. She’s a tough chewer already but hasn’t been able to break this bone apart at all.
customer_reviews.author: cristen430

customer_reviews.title: My puppy absolutely loved this bone and chewing on it
customer_reviews.text: This toy is dangerous! My puppy absolutely loved this bone and chewing on it.... for about 3 hours. Then the ends started to come off in little pieces that my puppy then wanted to eat. So after 3 hours of playing with it I had to take it away from him and throw it away! I can’t believe they still sell this kind of product. I went to the store and got the same brand- but the edible kind- and it was much better! Should really take the nonedible bones off the shelf!
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PETITE RING
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this twin pack in August for our small mixed breed 'power chewer'. She immediately broke small pieces off the brown bone which we threw away. The five stars are for the ring - still her favorite at 9 months, 10+ pounds (is chewing on it as I type). She immediately destroys every other chew toy given to her. I definitely can recommend the ring if you have had bad experience with other treats in this category.
customer_reviews.author: Suki's mom - Or-e-gun

customer_reviews.title: Puppy Ate it to pieces...
customer_reviews.text: Actually wanted to contact seller for advice, but there was no option available. My son's puppy chewed the bone to pieces, and he could not find all of them. Just a little worried about her ingesting the product. I am sure they must be non toxic to dogs, but all the same, a little worried. On a positive note...it smelled delicious, and I am guessing she LIKED it! Yikes....haven't given her the ring yet, just to see if everything turns out ok.!!
customer_reviews.author: mamma

customer_reviews.title: Not for aggressive chewers
customer_reviews.text: I got two puppies (a toy poodle and yorkie) both 7 months old Rn. My toy poodle loved the bigger bone and is a light chewer so I didn’t think anything of it. However my yorkie got ahold of it and is such an aggressive chewer he tore the thing up in just a matter of minutes. I checked here to see if it was safe for him to eat and saw nothing that said it was so I threw it away and didn’t waste my time getting my money back or anything. Yorkie doesn’t like the smaller toy but my toy poodle is starting to play with it more. I don’t really recommend.
customer_reviews.author: AlexW

customer_reviews.title: ... ringed one is hard plastic so my puppy didn't like the chew it
customer_reviews.text: The light brown ringed one is hard plastic so my puppy didn't like the chew it. He liked the smell but after a few licks and feeling how hard it was he lost interest fast. He loved the brown bone, it has a strong smell. But unfortunately one of the dogs he had a doggie play date with grabbed it and when he was out of site completely destroyed it in a matter of minutes. Not his fault lol but just letting you know it's not for strong chewers.
customer_reviews.author: kpv

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what it is but my dogs are total slaves for these. They loooove them, but the best part is that the edible one is one of the only bones of this type that doesn't upset my dogs' stomachs like a lot of other brands, and the chew toy one lasts ages. A really good deal for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Veronica

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my puppy and she basically was able to eat the bone shaped bone in no time making herself sick. She is a 10 pound puppy I would not buy this item for an aggressive chewer. The bone with the round center is good but not the bone shaped one.
customer_reviews.author: CB.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and use
customer_reviews.text: My puppy got plenty of use out of this set. She wasn't as interested in it as other dogs, but she still used it for her teething period and it helped. Once they have their full adult set, I do not recommend leaving the dog unsupervised while chewing on these. My 30-lb dog managed to tear them apart and ate a large chunk of the adult bone, but that's on me. All toys are breakable, one way or another.
customer_reviews.author: Maite

customer_reviews.title: Durable and my dogs like them
customer_reviews.text: My dogs are not puppies but are smaller (15 & 35lbs) and they seem to prefer this smaller size of chew toy. I was worried that they might only want to chew plastic that’s forbidden, but they actually seem to like these chew toys. They are holding up well so far - after a few days of use there’s not much visible damage.
customer_reviews.author: T. MooreTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Too small, not sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Unless your puppy is 2 months old, I wouldn't recommend. Our 5 month old puppy had the bone ripped up in about 15 minutes, and swallowed a piece, so I had to throw it out.
customer_reviews.author: AW

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as an add on item which made them far less expensive then purchasing them in the store. They came in a two pack which made them even more appealing. I gave a 4 star rating due to the fact that while my dog will occasionally play with them or chew on them he avoids them for the most part and would rather play with other things or teeth on other options that we have for him. This is still a great product and one of few that I would leave my dog alone with.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie DeValcourt

customer_reviews.title: Teething puppy loved this!
customer_reviews.text: Both bones have been great for a teething miniature husky - he loves the bacon smell and will happily chew on these. The end of the bone with the circle in the center did wear down after some chewing so I threw that bone away for safety reasons - afraid a portion would break off and end up in his stomach. Great product and it was much more affordable online vs. instore at Petsmart.
customer_reviews.author: Whitney

customer_reviews.title: My pup didn't care about the teething puppy bone until ...
customer_reviews.text: My pup didn't care about the teething puppy bone until AFTER he started losing his baby teeth and just tore it into pieces. I threw away because I didn't want him to swallow a large piece. He does chew on the other one every once in awhile. There's a few nicks in it but he doesn't really seem too interested in it.
customer_reviews.author: Rose ChristoTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: The Pups Love it
customer_reviews.text: The pups Love the soft one, the only problem is they Chew pieces off and the pieces dont dissolve no matter how much they chew it. So u must watch that they dont just get tired of chewing and try to swallow the chunk. The harder one doesnt seem to have as much scent to entice them to chew on it. Over all I would recommend, how can u deny the pups something they love😊
customer_reviews.author: Frazzled Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Wouldnt recommend
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my puppy it was great at first he loved them but after awhile I started to notice chunks of the plastic falling off and he would be chewing on them. I ended up throwing them away. Even my 6lb pomchi would end up having plastic pieces as well.
customer_reviews.author: Angel Esperanza

customer_reviews.title: One of the few toys that last
customer_reviews.text: This is for the hard bone not the puppy one ... we just throw this one away. Our 12lb cairn terrier is an extremely (!) heavy chewer and goes through most toys in one nibbling session. We bought four of these already since he likes them so much (and sometimes they are being hid in the strangest places). The hard bone is so hard that cutting it with a kitchen knife is practically impossible. The picture shows his progress in destruction after two weeks (top) to one month daily chewing (bottom). This is the only toy besides the kong with that we feel comfortable leaving him alone with.
customer_reviews.author: Hesoste

customer_reviews.title: DON’T BUY
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my puppy (5 months or so at the time) who was very rough when chewing on things due to teething. I thought this would do the trick and when he started chewing on it for the first two or three days I figured it was working; not necessarily. He demolished it but by bit with nothing in its remains. It’s not as durable as it claims and had my dog throwing up the pieces he chewed off.
customer_reviews.author: Mercedes

customer_reviews.title: My pup doesn't care for these
customer_reviews.text: I am sure these are high quality, durable treats for puppies and dogs. But my dog didn't care for it. It's noted to be scented, but she wouldn't even bother with them. I gave them to my neighbor's dog who seems to love them though.
customer_reviews.author: Bargainbliss

customer_reviews.title: Should be great for a normal puppy
customer_reviews.text: My Godzilla-jawed puppy tore right through these, but that just makes them part of a long line-up of toys that she decimated. I finally found a couple types that she doesn't destroy. I think a normal puppy would do really well with these though.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: My puppy loves them
customer_reviews.text: We just added a new puppy to our house that is still teething , and is a very small dog. (Chi). These are great for him. They help him teeth and are small enough for him to chew on. The bone itself has a more of a giving material to it than the one with the circle, but he uses both. He loves them!
customer_reviews.author: the mrs b

customer_reviews.title: the bone is not for aggressive chewers.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the product as did my puppy but she chipped off and swallowed a small piece in 5 minutes that she had the bone. Luckily I threw it away before she bit off more and she threw up the little pieces she had eaten. The other piece is for puppies who already have their permanent teeth so I'm keeping it for later.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Border collie puppy
customer_reviews.text: Our pup was ten weeks when she got these, now she is 12. The bone with the ring doesn't get much attention yet, but the other is a big hit. Update 8/1 - she never touched the bone with the ring, so I'd have been better off just getting a regular nylabone.
customer_reviews.author: EtherTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Too hard for Yorkie puppies
customer_reviews.text: These are too hard for my Yorkie puppies. I bought them for teething, but they can’t really chew them and leave them alone. I donated them to our local shelter after a bath in the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Michele Laughlin

customer_reviews.title: Not durable at all
customer_reviews.text: My 5lb poodle mix and 9lb schnauzer basically ATE the puppy one. Not safe and barely made it half the day. They have no interest in the other one for “graduates.” Both pups are 5 month old tiny things
customer_reviews.author: Lyn Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Nom Nom Nom
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for our new Golden Retriever puppy and she likes them. She chews on everything from shoes to your face and these helped confine her to acceptable things to destroy. They're sturdy and hold up well to her daily gnawing!
customer_reviews.author: JPJ Photography & Media

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great price
customer_reviews.text: Great price & the Dalmatian pup loves them, they don’t have any nasty smells like some treats. He is a hard chewer and they have yet to get holes or tears in them yet they are somewhat soft and flexible to they won’t hurt him.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Mama Moon

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with Nylabone
customer_reviews.text: My two pups love to chew on this nylabone chew toy. It is a Excellent addition to their chew Toys and such a hit ,I've already ordered another Nylabone Chew Toy. I say purchase this for your growing pup you will be happy with your purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Janice Vandiver

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last 10 minutes!
customer_reviews.text: This didn't even last the teething puppy 10 minutes. She is only 9lbs and was able to destroy one end in a matter of minutes. Tried to swap it out for the round one and she had no interest in it. Waste of money. She has other chews that last longer.
customer_reviews.author: ShoppingLadyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great for teething puppies
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for teething puppies and just puppies that love to chew. We are now on the next level one included in this 2 pack, and it's our dog's favorite chew toy.
customer_reviews.author: Jojo's Momma

customer_reviews.title: Skip this
customer_reviews.text: They loved it because of the smell but it did not last in chunks broke off and that is not healthy for them to eat or digest. The packaging also says do not let them swallow it. It breaks off way too easy this is not a good product at least for a med to large sized puppy
customer_reviews.author: Gamer K

customer_reviews.title: Dog chew Toy
customer_reviews.text: I didn't care for this, because my little dog doesn't chew on it, and wish it was a different color, everytime I look at it, I think my dog had an accident and I am in the training process. LOL but it is well made and nice size
customer_reviews.author: HollyBelle

customer_reviews.title: All my dogs love these
customer_reviews.text: I bought for my Basset puppy, but my adult dogs who never liked any type of nylabone, stole these. I bought more in their size and they all love them but they're holding up fairly well
customer_reviews.author: Julie Graves

customer_reviews.title: Wait, what?  Not an edible?!
customer_reviews.text: Not an edible...really? Wasn't obvious on the product listing or on the front of the packaging. Nylabone just lost my business for everything as our puppy ate it and got sick!!
customer_reviews.author: Majkboy

customer_reviews.title: RIP OFF!
customer_reviews.text: 5 lb Chihuahua destroyed the end of the bone in 2 days. We had to throw it away because... Bits of plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Gravitt

customer_reviews.title: Made my beagle pup sick.
customer_reviews.text: Made my 6 month old beagle sick. The brown one she chewed off the ends and threw them up. The tan one she won't even touch. I threw both of them away. I bought 4 different chew items, hope the next 3 do not have the same effect. Afraid to even try something new after this experience. I would not recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: G. Breehl

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: Nylabone toys are our favorite for the puppy! He’s a power chewer and he can’t destroy these toys! We purchased lots of them and continue to be pleased with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: lala76

customer_reviews.title: The dogs like it
customer_reviews.text: This was great while it lasted. My puppy was never interested in the one with the hole in it. She liked the starter bone the most. Had to take it away from her because she actually started pulling it apart when she was only 4 months
customer_reviews.author: ADS

customer_reviews.title: Huge Success!
customer_reviews.text: She didn't even want to follow me while I grabbed my phone for this photo!!! She loves it! Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Cate Martin

customer_reviews.title: Made puppies sick
customer_reviews.text: It shipped pretty quick. The bones seem durable but made my puppies sick so I took them away.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok
customer_reviews.text: Our puppy doesn’t like these much. One is just hard plastic, and the other is a softer chew but still too hard for her to enjoy. As she gets older she may enjoy it more but was hoping for something that was softer that she could really sink her teeth into.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY! EMERGENCY VET VIST.
customer_reviews.text: This product was horrible. My puppy was chewing it and the little pieces almost caused a bowel obstruction. Two emergency vet visits later and $800 shes back on the mend. Nylabone shouldn't be making these products anymore. DO NOT BUY THESE FOR ANY DOG. They almost killed my puppy.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Half eaten before I noticed.
customer_reviews.text: SO DANGEROUS! My 12 pound dog had eaten 1/2-1/3 of this bone before I noticed! I thought he would gnaw on it for a week or so, but surely not EAT it like this.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney

customer_reviews.title: 🦷 Teething Chews
customer_reviews.text: Very good product, we’ve almost gone though two packs in almost 2.5 months ♥️⭐️🐾
customer_reviews.author: CAROLYN JOBST

customer_reviews.title: Never chew
customer_reviews.text: The dog was not interested in it , so he ate it once and never ate it again.
customer_reviews.author: jack Barta

customer_reviews.title: Our reservation rescue puppy demolished the softer chew in about ...
customer_reviews.text: Our reservation rescue puppy demolished the softer chew in about a week. It was a saving grace for the wood in the house! He occasionally picks up the harder one, and I assume will eventually take to it depending on his teething. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: gritz in the morning

customer_reviews.title: The product arrived in perfect condition. The instructions say to use the one ...
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived in perfect condition. The instructions say to use the one with the nubs as the puppy gets a bit older so we've only used the smooth one. She likes it but does lose interest faster than with a rawhide. I so hoped this would interest her more. We'll keep trying with it.
customer_reviews.author: Dianne

customer_reviews.title: Not for aggressive chewers
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product but they did not last long with my puppy. She is an aggressive chewer and went threw these in 3 days.
customer_reviews.author: NikkiFar83

customer_reviews.title: Won't buy again
customer_reviews.text: Didn't even last 4 days......puppy chewed them to little nubs, had to throw out. Was afraid puppy would swallow them. Maybe my puppy has chain saw for teeth!
customer_reviews.author: IrishRose

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: My puppy adores these little bones and they are the perfect size for her little mouth. She is an 8 week old Goldendoodle.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra Gee

customer_reviews.title: My morkie puppy loves it!
customer_reviews.text: It is great but ours has a big hole in the one end. Regardless, my puppy loves it!
customer_reviews.author: rachel boos

customer_reviews.title: My boy loves them
customer_reviews.text: Excellent toy for any teething puppy my sweet boy can’t get enough of the scented bone
customer_reviews.author: becky spitzer

customer_reviews.title: Better the chew toy instead of your 1000$ rug corners.
customer_reviews.text: Dog rips right through them. Other dog not so much. Great product. The young Pom really goes to town on them. I bought a bunch because got a better deal. Should last six months. Hopefully Pom will be done chewing everything thing in sight.
customer_reviews.author: Gunnar Vogtmann

customer_reviews.title: Nice texture
customer_reviews.text: Great for our puppy, not to hard but hard enough to be durable.
customer_reviews.author: KY

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Great for chewers. This kept my Chihuahua busy & prevents him from bitting on things he shouldn’t. We no longer have the item since it’s been a while since I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Simone Alicia

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: My teething puppy loves them. As does my 3 year old dog who steals them from her. Good price for a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Doctor Mom

customer_reviews.title: teething
customer_reviews.text: my lil baby shih tzu loves these toys perfect for him
customer_reviews.author: Jeannie

customer_reviews.title: 2 for 1
customer_reviews.text: I think they're a little hard but my puppy seemed to like it during his teething stage, kept him off the furniture
customer_reviews.author: EgC

customer_reviews.title: Chew Ring Bone & Puppy Chew Bone
customer_reviews.text: My puppy loved the "Start" bone and chewed it into a nub. He barley plays and/or chews the "Graduate" bone, but hopefully he will in the future...
customer_reviews.author: McQueen

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Teething Toy
customer_reviews.text: My puppy LOVES the softer teething bone. Considering how much energy he has, he'll sit and chew it for an hour straight it if I'd let him. Unfortunately, now that he's bigger he does quite a bit of damage to it, so I cut off the overly chewed portion, and it's like he has a brand new toy!
customer_reviews.author: CiaraC

customer_reviews.title: Great for teething Puppy!!!
customer_reviews.text: I went to Petsmart to buy puppy toys for my new puppy, and was shocked at how expensive everything was! I quickly went on Amazon to comparison shop and found out it was half the price online. I left Petsmart empty handed but with a list of things to buy online. This product has held up well against my teething puppy and she loves both the bone and the chew toy! Great for the teething puppy!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Definitely needs supervision, but a lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: My mini dachshund puppy absolutely loves the softer (straight) bone. He chews and destroys it pretty quick though, so every so often I need to cut off the chewed end with a paring knife so that he won't ingest the plastic. It's not an ideal method, however he is too young for rawhides and is uninterested in most chew toys. This bone has been a real lifesaver for teething!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda R.

customer_reviews.title: So So chew for a puppy.
customer_reviews.text: Not a good choice for teething like a puppy Nylabone.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: My puppy didn’t really enjoy the toy but it was the right size for him.
customer_reviews.author: Genesis Valle

customer_reviews.title: Be warned..
customer_reviews.text: I cannot believe they say these are for puppies. Do NOT get your baby a hard as a rock chewie like this. If you get it please be warned and also you will see what I mean..
customer_reviews.author: Hillary Knuckles

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: My puppy did not like the 1st at all and kinda sorta goes after the graduate one. Not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My puppy showed no interest in these
customer_reviews.text: I always thought she had had an accident when I saw them lying on the floor. LOL
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Teething bones
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping, good quality, but my puppy has no interest in these.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Mantle

customer_reviews.title: Good for puppies
customer_reviews.text: My puppy loved these. My 4 year old dog loved them as well and stole them from my puppy. Definitely specified for small dogs for a reason, silly boy. But, while it lasted, was happy with it as my pup enjoyed them.
customer_reviews.author: Faith

customer_reviews.title: Puppy loves the bone but the other one is just plastic
customer_reviews.text: Package contains 2 items. One bone shaped which the puppy loves but the other one is just a plastic shape. Not the same material or I guess taste.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for my puppy. She chewed in minutes and ate the plastic pieces.
customer_reviews.text: Nope. It's plastic and my puppy had half it off, chewed up and ate in a matter of minutes. To the garbage can. They are not safe for consumption.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Puppy gift
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift. I know veterinarians recommend these over rawhide as they are a safer choice and all dogs need to chew. This is a good starter pack for a puppy.
customer_reviews.author: designer on the side

customer_reviews.title: Teething
customer_reviews.text: Product good but my puppy chewed it I had to throw it away right away
customer_reviews.author: Genevieve Burroni

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: I would stay away from this product. The bone comes apart into little pieces, and I am sure this is not healthy to swallow. It did not take my dog too long to break it apart, so A+ on flavor??
customer_reviews.author: Dave's Tech

customer_reviews.title: I'm sorry but I'm not at all happy with this
customer_reviews.text: My puppy is very small, she's a Chihuahua, and the small yellow one is an o. k. size but the bone is way too big for my puppy. I got this because it said it was petite for puppies. I'm sorry but I'm not at all happy with this, it's just way too big for a small puppy.
customer_reviews.author: Amy  51

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping. Dog will naw on it on occasion. Didnt expect anything different.
customer_reviews.author: Sidney Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Idk WHY, BUT my pup was NOT to fond of neither...As a matter of FACT, she LITERALLY stopped checking the items out, got up and went and got the pkg it came in...she chewed on that more than she did the 2 toys...
customer_reviews.author: E&J Johnson

customer_reviews.title: No interest
customer_reviews.text: These seem like good quality, however, my puppy doesn't like them. She has not interest in any of the nylabones.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: dog likes it
customer_reviews.text: have since moved to bully sticks because they are digestible.
customer_reviews.author: Zak

customer_reviews.title: Great little bones
customer_reviews.text: These are great. Our little girl really loves the dark brown one the best. She doesn't touch the other one too much yet, but I am sure that will change the bigger her mouth and teeth are! Nice to have the two options!
customer_reviews.author: MNPF76

customer_reviews.title: The softer chew was destroyed in a week by our ...
customer_reviews.text: The softer chew was destroyed in a week by our 6lb puppy, but the ring chew is still going strong. For a solid chew toy we switched to Petstages ruffwood.
customer_reviews.author: AJK

customer_reviews.title: Dogs liked
customer_reviews.text: The dogs like them so much they hid them somewhere and I haven't seen them since
customer_reviews.author: Buyer2345

customer_reviews.title: Good price and quality toy
customer_reviews.text: Love this set. It is harder plastic but not inflexible. I've bought them for my puppies and bought more sets for my small dogs. I also purchase these for a local rescue shelter because it's a great deal cheaper than local pet stores.
customer_reviews.author: TS in Florida

customer_reviews.title: Good Deal!!
customer_reviews.text: Our puppy loves chewing on these bones!! Teething at it's best!
customer_reviews.author: Mindy BB

customer_reviews.title: Is broken.
customer_reviews.text: It was bitten by our dog and then it broke. That’s pathetic.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia Koenig

customer_reviews.title: The darker colored bone splintered into chunks of plastic. ...
customer_reviews.text: The darker colored bone splintered into chunks of plastic. I was concerned that the puppy might choke. Our veterinarian advised us to avoid any potential complications from swallowing the plastic and just throw the bone away. Overall I would have hoped for a more durable product. Would not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Green

customer_reviews.title: These last forever!!
customer_reviews.text: No joke, these will last a lifetime. Nylabone is no joke when it comes to quality!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren A. Mccauley

customer_reviews.title: but overall a great product.
customer_reviews.text: My pup loves these bones! The ring bone is much harder so she is still showing more interest in the softer bone, but overall a great product.
customer_reviews.author: DblA-ron

customer_reviews.title: Only okay
customer_reviews.text: They were super super small. Perfect for our pup now but only for a short while.
customer_reviews.author: Taramonnahan

customer_reviews.title: Puppy loves it
customer_reviews.text: These things last forever! It’s definitely a great product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Burton

customer_reviews.title: I have as yet only used the bone intended for ...
customer_reviews.text: I have as yet only used the bone intended for the younger puppies. She started to eat the end of it in very short order and I had not read the instructions completely before I gave it to her. Took it away as soon as I realized it was not edible and threw it away. I am reluctant to give her the other and if I do will totally supervise
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie E

product_meta.title: Nylabone Puppy Chew Ring Bone & Toy Twin Pack, Flavor Medley, 2 count, Petite
product_meta.description: Treat your new family member to this perfect combination of puppy toys! This value pack includes two long lasting chew toys designed to encourage positive chewing habits, containing savory chicken and flavor medley taste throughout. The first puppy toy is made of softer, flexible material made just for teething puppies! The second is a durable nylon bone for your puppy to chew when he has all of his adult teeth. Both toys help promote clean teeth and discourage destructive chewing. These chew toys are the perfect pastime for your teething puppy! Color may vary.
feature_bullets: Flexible chew toy and nylon bone help with puppy teething while cleaning teeth and freshening breath
Chew toys keep puppies busy and help prevent destructive chewing
Mini chew toys intended for puppies up to 15 pounds
Small dog chews contain delicious flavor medley and chicken flavor dogs love
Chew toys made in the USA
Nylabone Puppy Chew toys encourage nondestructive chewing habits while satisfying the natural urge to chew
Softer material designed for teething puppies
Bristles raised during chewing help clean teeth and control plaque and tartar

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
